'''Conary''' is a [[free software]] [[package management system]] created by [[rPath]] and distributed under the terms of the [[Common Public License]].<ref name="license">{{cite web|url=ftp://download.rpath.com/pub/conary/|title=Download location of source code; each archive contains a "LICENSE" file which contains the Common Public License|}}</ref> It focuses on installing packages through automated dependency resolution against distributed online [[Linux repository|repositories]], and providing a concise and easy-to-use [[Python (language)|Python]]-based description language to specify how to build a package. It is used by [[Foresight Linux]] and [[RPath|rPath Linux]].
+
'''Conary''' is a [[free software]] [[package management system]] created by [[rPath]] and distributed under the terms of the [[Common Public License]].<ref name="license">{{cite web|url=ftp://download.rpath.com/pub/conary/|title=Download location of source code; each archive contains a "LICENSE" file which contains the Common Public License|}}</ref> It focuses on installing packages through automated dependency resolution against distributed online [[Software repository|repositories]], and providing a concise and easy-to-use [[Python (language)|Python]]-based description language to specify how to build a package. It is used by [[Foresight Linux]] and [[RPath|rPath Linux]].
Conary updates only those specific files in packages which need to be updated; this behavior minimizes bandwidth and time requirements for updating software packages. Conary also features [[Rollback (data management)|Rollback]]s<ref name=rollbacks>[http://wiki.rpath.com/wiki/Conary:Roll_Back_a_Trove_HOWTO Conary:conary rollback - rPath Wiki<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> of package installation as well as derived packages <ref name="derived_packages">[http://ewtroan.livejournal.com/16174.html ewtroan: Derived Packages<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>.
Conary updates only those specific files in packages which need to be updated; this behavior minimizes bandwidth and time requirements for updating software packages. Conary also features [[Rollback (data management)|Rollback]]s<ref name=rollbacks>[http://wiki.rpath.com/wiki/Conary:Roll_Back_a_Trove_HOWTO Conary:conary rollback - rPath Wiki<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> of package installation as well as derived packages <ref name="derived_packages">[http://ewtroan.livejournal.com/16174.html ewtroan: Derived Packages<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>.
